item.title: My mother tripped and fell on a pothole at Black Horse Road, Sidcup and resulted in A&E admission!, 20th February
item.description:
On Friday 30th January 2026 my mother and Moller’s visited The Star Cafe and Bistro in Sidcup high street; the restaurant closed at 18:00pm where we left and made a slow walk back up to my mothers car which was parked in allocated parking bays….; my mother walked ahead of me (as she has done hundreds of times as we are regular weekly visitors to the bistro); on this occasion my mother walked on the pavement having crossed at the zebra crossing and up in to Black Horse Road…; my mother stepped off the kerb and in to the road having to cross to her parked car…; my mother tripped and fell down as a result from the pothole which was full of water (as shown in the picture). That evening we visited QM hospital urgent care department at 21:30pm and was immediately transferred to a&e with our choice being PRU over near Orpington; I was with my mother all night until 10:00am Saturday 31st January 2026 when my mum chose to not stay at the hospital….; after many tests, scans and examinations my mother came away with two broken ribs. Is there a department where we can attempt to put in a claim as this should have never happened if the highways was to be maintained to a much higher standard; And this road especially doesn’t seem to have had any inspections or repair works carried out in months if not years as the road in general is in an appalling state?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, High Street, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
